tool.name: OTB.SARDecompositions
tool.description: From one-band complex images (each one related to an element of the Sinclair matrix), returns the selected decomposition.
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayinhh False isArrayinhv False isArrayinvh False isArrayinvv False output_data_out $output_data_out name OTB.SARDecompositions inhh $inhh inhv $inhv invh $invh invv $invv out $out decomp $decomp inco.kernelsize $inco.kernelsize ram $ram prefer $prefer response $response outputType_out $OutputSection_out.outputType_out transmissionMode_out $OutputSection_out.transmissionMode_out

param.name: inhh
param.label: Input image (HH)
param.help: Input image (HH) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, png, jpeg

param.name: inhv
param.label: Input image (HV)
param.help: Input image (HV) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, png, jpeg

param.name: invh
param.label: Input image (VH)
param.help: Input image (VH) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, png, jpeg

param.name: invv
param.label: Input image (VV)
param.help: Input image (VV) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, png, jpeg

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_out
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

tool.help: From one-band complex images (HH, HV, VH, VV), returns the selected decomposition. All the decompositions implemented are intended for the mono-static case (transmitter and receiver are co-located).There are two kinds of decomposition : coherent ones and incoherent ones.In the coherent case, only the Pauli decomposition is available.In the incoherent case, there the decompositions available : Huynen, Barnes, and H-alpha-A.User must provide three one-band complex images HH, HV or VH, and VV (mono-static case
